description: Configuration file definition for sfdx-hardis Salesforce DX plugin

promptsLanguage.description: Language used for AI-generated prompts. If not set, the default language is English (en). Supported languages are defined in the code but not limited to: English (en), French (fr), Spanish (es), German (de), Italian (it), Portuguese (pt). If multiple languages, separate them with comma and the first one will be used as default language for prompts. (mirrors PROMPTS_LANGUAGE environment variable)
promptsLanguage.title: Prompts language(s)

promptsParallelCallNumber.description: Number of parallel AI prompt calls when generating project documentation. Higher values speed up documentation generation but may hit API rate limits. (mirrors PROMPTS_PARALLEL_CALL_NUMBER environment variable)
promptsParallelCallNumber.title: Prompts parallel call number

useLangchainLlm.description: Set to true to enable LangChain integration (mirrors the USE_LANGCHAIN_LLM environment variable).
useLangchainLlm.title: Enable LangChain

langchainLlmProvider.description: LLM provider identifier used with LangChain (ex: openai, anthropic, google-genai, ollama). Equivalent to LANGCHAIN_LLM_PROVIDER env var.
langchainLlmProvider.title: LangChain provider

langchainLlmModel.description: Model identifier to use with the configured LangChain provider. Latest models: OpenAI (gpt-5.2, gpt-5.2-mini, gpt-5, gpt-4.1, gpt-4o, gpt-4o-mini...), Anthropic (claude-opus-4-6, claude-3-5-sonnet, claude-3-5-haiku, claude-3-haiku...), Google Gemini (gemini-3-pro, gemini-3-pro-deep-think, gemini-3-flash, gemini-2.5-flash-lite...). Equivalent to LANGCHAIN_LLM_MODEL env var.
langchainLlmModel.title: LangChain model

langchainLlmTemperature.description: Sampling temperature override for LangChain requests (maps to LANGCHAIN_LLM_TEMPERATURE env var).
langchainLlmTemperature.title: LangChain temperature

langchainLlmMaxTokens.description: Maximum number of tokens generated per LangChain response (maps to LANGCHAIN_LLM_MAX_TOKENS env var).
langchainLlmMaxTokens.title: LangChain max tokens

langchainLlmMaxRetries.description: Maximum number of retries for failed LangChain requests (maps to LANGCHAIN_LLM_MAX_RETRIES env var).
langchainLlmMaxRetries.title: LangChain max retries

langchainLlmTimeout.description: Timeout in milliseconds applied to LangChain calls (maps to LANGCHAIN_LLM_TIMEOUT env var).
langchainLlmTimeout.title: LangChain timeout

langchainLlmBaseUrl.description: Custom base URL for LangChain HTTP-based providers (for example a local Ollama endpoint). Equivalent to LANGCHAIN_LLM_BASE_URL env var.
langchainLlmBaseUrl.title: LangChain base URL

useOpenaiDirect.description: Set to true to enable the direct OpenAI connector (mirrors USE_OPENAI_DIRECT env var).
useOpenaiDirect.title: Enable OpenAI

openaiModel.description: Name of the OpenAI model to use by default (ex: gpt-4o, gpt-4o-mini). Equivalent to OPENAI_MODEL env var.
openaiModel.title: OpenAI model

useAgentforce.description: Set to true to enable Agentforce integration (mirrors USE_AGENTFORCE env var).
useAgentforce.title: Enable Agentforce

genericAgentforcePromptTemplate.description: Prompt template API name to use by default (ex: SfdxHardisGenericPrompt). Equivalent to GENERIC_AGENTFORCE_PROMPT_TEMPLATE env var.
genericAgentforcePromptTemplate.title: Agentforce prompt template

genericAgentforcePromptUrl.description: Custom Agentforce template URL supporting placeholders {{API_VERSION}} and {{GENERIC_AGENTFORCE_PROMPT_TEMPLATE}} (mirrors GENERIC_AGENTFORCE_PROMPT_URL env var).
genericAgentforcePromptUrl.title: Agentforce prompt URL

allowedOrgTypes.description: Types of Salesforce Orgs allowed for config & development. If not set, Sandbox Orgs and Scratch Orgs are allowed by default
allowedOrgTypes.title: Allowed org types

autoCleanTypes.description:
When saving/publishing a User Story, sfdx-hardis can automatically clean the sources before submitting a Pull Request.
Select the cleanings that will be automatically applied on your project.
autoCleanTypes.title: Auto-Cleaning types

autoRemoveUserPermissions.description:
When your dev sandbox is using the next SF Platform version, sometimes some permissions on Profiles exist on the next version but not the current one.
To avoid issues, you can force the removal of such permissions when Saving/Publishing a User Story
Example:
- EnableCommunityAppLauncher
- OmnichannelInventorySync
autoRemoveUserPermissions.title: Auto-Remove User Permissions on profiles

autoRetrieveWhenPull.description:
Sometimes, SF Cli forgets to pull some metadata updates, like Custom Application for example.
sfdx-hardis can automatically retrieve named metadatas to avoid issues.
Example:
- CustomApplication:MyApp1
- CustomApplication:MyApp2
Works also with full metadata types (ex: CustomApplication)
autoRetrieveWhenPull.title: Auto-Retrieve when pull

apexTestsMinCoverageOrgWide.description:
Minimum percentage of apex code coverage accepted.
75.0% by default, but if you are on a clean project, it's better to define 80.0, 95.0 or 90.0 ðŸ˜Ž
apexTestsMinCoverageOrgWide.title: Minimum Apex Tests coverage % accepted for a deployment

availableProjects.description:
List of business projects that are managed in the same repository.
If defined, when creating a new User Story, it will be prompted to the contributor then used to create the git branch name.
If a value contains a comma, the left part will be used for key and the right part as label for the users.
availableProjects.title: Available projects

availableTargetBranches.description:
List of git branches that can be used as target for Pull Requests.
Contributors will be prompt to select one of these target branch when creating a new User Story
A classic example on a project with BUILD & RUN in parallel is to have preprod and integration as available target branches.
If defined, makes obsolete the parameter Default Pull Request target branch.
availableTargetBranches.title: Available PR/MR target branches

testLevel.description: WARNING: Use with caution, only in branch scoped config! You can override default test level for deployments for special use cases, for example when you have SeeAllData=true you can use RunRepositoryTests associated with a regex in runtests option
enumNames: Run Local Tests (recommended at least for production deployments)
Run Relevant Tests (beta since Spring 26, still new so use with caution)
Run Repository Tests (will run only test classes that are present in the repository)
Run Repository Tests Except SeeAllData (same than RunRepositoryTests but without test classes with SeeAllData=true)
Run Specified Tests (never use it, instead use Run Local Tests + deploymentApexTestClasses)
Run All Tests In Org (never use it)
No Test Run (not recommended, better use Run Local Tests + deploymentApexTestClasses)

useDeltaDeployment.description:
Defines if sfdx-hardis will deploy in delta from minor to major branches.
When active, Delta Deployments allow to deploy only the metadatas in the branch / User Story, and not the full sources of the SFDX project.
Note: Even if activated, Delta Deployments will be applied only for Pull Requests from minor (features,hotfixes) to major branches (integration,preprod).
useDeltaDeployment.title: Use Delta Deployment

useDeltaDeploymentWithDependencies.description:
Also deploy dependencies of the metadatas identified by delta deployment, to avoid broken deployments due to missing dependencies.
 Example: removed picklist value in a field, that is still used in a record type.
useDeltaDeploymentWithDependencies.title: Use Delta Deployment with dependencies (beta)

useSmartDeploymentTests.description:
Define if Smart Deployment Tests will be activated and run Apex test classes only if metadata that can impact them are present in the branch / User Story.
Note: Smart Deployment Tests will be applied only for Pull Requests from minor (features,hotfixes) to major branches (integration,preprod).
useSmartDeploymentTests.title: Use Smart Deployment Tests
